Line 172: Line 172:
{{Main|Grand Valley State Lakers}}
{{Main|Grand Valley State Lakers}}
{{See also|Grand Valley State Lakers football}}
{{See also|Grand Valley State Lakers football}}
â
[[File:Grand Valley State Athletics Logo.jpg|thumb|Grand Valley State Athletics Logo]]
 
The Grand Valley State Lakers are the intercollegiate athletic teams of Grand Valley State University.<ref name=quickfacts>{{cite web | title = Quick Facts About Grand Valley | work = Grand Valley State University web site| publisher = Grand Valley State University | url = http://www.gvsu.edu/index.cfm?fuseaction=home.aboutgvsu | accessdate = February 23, 2010}}</ref> The GVSU Lakers compete at the [[Division II (NCAA)|NCAA Division II]] level and are members of the [[Great Lakes Intercollegiate Athletic Conference]] (GLIAC). Grand Valley's varsity athletic teams have won seven national championships in four sports and have been national runners-up thirteen times in eight sports. GVSU has also won the prestigious National Association of Collegiate Directors of Athletics [[NACDA Director's Cup|(NACDA) Directors' Cup]] for NCAA Division II schools in 2004, 2005, 2006, 2007, 2008, 2009, and 2010 after finishing second in 2002 and 2003.<ref name="NACDA">{{cite web|url=http://www.nacda.com/directorscup/nacda-directorscup-previous-scoring.html|title=NACDA Directors Cup|publisher=CBS Interactive|accessdate=13 December 2009}}</ref> The cup is awarded to the top athletic programs based on overall team national finishes. Grand Valley is the first college east of the Mississippi River to win the Director's Cup for NCAA Division II.
The Grand Valley State Lakers are the intercollegiate athletic teams of Grand Valley State University.<ref name=quickfacts>{{cite web | title = Quick Facts About Grand Valley | work = Grand Valley State University web site| publisher = Grand Valley State University | url = http://www.gvsu.edu/index.cfm?fuseaction=home.aboutgvsu | accessdate = February 23, 2010}}</ref> The GVSU Lakers compete at the [[Division II (NCAA)|NCAA Division II]] level and are members of the [[Great Lakes Intercollegiate Athletic Conference]] (GLIAC). Grand Valley's varsity athletic teams have won seven national championships in four sports and have been national runners-up thirteen times in eight sports. GVSU has also won the prestigious National Association of Collegiate Directors of Athletics [[NACDA Director's Cup|(NACDA) Directors' Cup]] for NCAA Division II schools in 2004, 2005, 2006, 2007, 2008, 2009, and 2010 after finishing second in 2002 and 2003.<ref name="NACDA">{{cite web|url=http://www.nacda.com/directorscup/nacda-directorscup-previous-scoring.html|title=NACDA Directors Cup|publisher=CBS Interactive|accessdate=13 December 2009}}</ref> The cup is awarded to the top athletic programs based on overall team national finishes. Grand Valley is the first college east of the Mississippi River to win the Director's Cup for NCAA Division II.
